priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Tumor Response Result Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96785

self.title: CDISC SDTM Tumor Response Result Terminology

definition: Terminology for oncology studies relevant to the result of response to treatment or therapy assessment within the disease response and clinical classification domain.
name: Oncology Response Assessment Result
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Tumor Response Result Terminology

terms.definition: The absence of change in the overall attenuation of the metastasis and in the peripheral rim, suggesting a lack of response to treatment.
The amount of cancer antigen 125 is reduced by 50% from protocol-defined baseline value(s).
The amount of cancer antigen 125 is reduced by 75% from protocol-defined baseline value(s).
The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation.

The disappearance of cancer in response to treatment, including platelet and white blood cell counts returning to normal levels, a non-palpable spleen, and no immature white blood cells present in the blood unless it is a regenerating marrow following treatment.
The disappearance of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions.
Absence of residual disease based on pre-defined thresholds and minimal residual disease negativity by laboratory techniques.
A decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on physical exam, such as palpation.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment. (NCI)
The disappearance of all signs of cancer, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.
terms.preferredTerm: Complete Response with Incomplete Bone Marrow Recovery
synonyms: Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery
Complete Response with Incomplete Bone Marrow Recovery

terms.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, including the absence of a detectable disease-related genetic abnormality, as determined by techniques such as karyotyping or FISH, in response to treatment.
A minimal decrease in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.
A minor decrease in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.
No change in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.
A partial decrease in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.
Made less in size, amount, degree, or extent.
A conversion from one disease diagnosis to another, which may be considered a progression to a worsening state.
Open to question.
No new lesions(s) and a decrease in lesion size, or a reduction in central necrosis or attenuation in one or more enhancing lesions, based on pre-defined thresholds.
An improvement in erythrocyte count as a response to treatment.
An improvement of neutrophil count as a response to treatment.
An improvement of platelet count as a response to treatment.
Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by the absence of phenotypically aberrant plasma cells (clonal) in bone marrow. (Rajkumar SV, Harousseau J, Durie B et al, Consensus recommendations for the uniform reporting of clinical trials: report of the International Myeloma Workshop Consensus Panel 1. Blood. 2011; 117(18):4691-4695)
A subjective response indicating that something has improved or gotten better.
A process of becoming larger, more intense, more extensive, more numerous, more important, or more likely.
A response that is neither favorable nor unfavorable.
A finding indicating that there is a decrease based on a predetermined threshold in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.
Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity based on predetermined boundaries following an initial apparent radiographic progression.
Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.
A major decrease in signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination and based on pre-defined thresholds.
A decrease in the number of bone marrow plasma cells to protocol-defined level(s).
A minor decrease in signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination and based on pre-defined thresholds.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by molecular analysis.
A decrease in signs of cancer, supported by molecular analysis.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by morphological analysis.
The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of cancer, accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.
terms.preferredTerm: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery
synonyms: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery
Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Bone Marrow Recovery

terms.definition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of leukemia, accompanied by bone marrow recovery, in response to treatment. Hematologic recovery is not required. Leukemia free state can be a hypocellular marrow.

A finding that refers to hematologic and solid malignancies and indicates that there is a minor improvement in the measures of disease burden, meeting a predetermined threshold, but not meeting partial response criteria.
Absence of minimal residual disease based on laboratory techniques.
Presence of residual disease based on pre-defined thresholds and quantifiable minimal residual disease positivity by laboratory techniques.
Presence of residual disease based on pre-defined thresholds and return of quantifiable minimal residual disease positivity after a period of minimal residual disease negativity.
Unable to be evaluated. (NCI)
An absence of detectable disease.
Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)
Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) without unequivocal progression following an initial apparent radiographic progression.
terms.preferredTerm: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease

terms.definition: Following a previous assessment of progressive disease unconfirmed (PDu) of non-target lesion(s), the subsequent required assessment does not confirm progressive disease.
Presence of non-quantifiable minimal residual disease based on laboratory techniques.
An indication that the subject's steroid dose is the same as their physiologic replacement dose.
terms.preferredTerm: No Steroid Use Beyond Physiologic Replacement Dose

terms.definition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.
Remission with remaining lymphoid nodules reflecting residual disease.
No apparent change or worsening in lesion staging classification.
Hypo-attenuation of the metastases which may appear pseudocystic, perfectly homogeneous, and devoid of a recognizable peripheral rim.
Mixed attenuation and some homogeneity of the metastases with a partially resolved peripheral rim.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination.
A disease process that is increasing in extent or severity. (NCI)
Disease progression occurring after a partial response.
There is an increase in the size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.
Disease progression or the return of a disease after a period of remission, occurring after a hematologic improvement.
terms.preferredTerm: Progression or Relapse After Hematologic Improvement
synonyms: Progression or Relapse After Hematologic Improvement

terms.definition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.
An increase of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions, based on pre-defined thresholds, or the development of new lesions.
A decrease of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions, based on a pre-defined threshold.
A finding indicating that there is a decrease based on a predetermined threshold in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer.
A decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer, accompanied by an increase in blood lymphocyte count above a predetermined threshold.
A decrease in the size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.
The amount of prostate specific antigen is increased, based on pre-defined thresholds.
Apparent increase in lesion burden, not proven to be disease progression.
Apparent decrease in lesion burden, not proven to be favorable treatment response.
Presence of quantifiable minimal residual disease based on laboratory techniques.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
The return of a disease after a period of complete remission.
The return of a disease after a period of complete remission or partial remission.
terms.preferredTerm: Relapsed Disease From Complete or Partial Response
terms.submissionValue: RELAPSED DISEASE FROM CR OR PR
synonyms: Relapsed Disease From Complete Response or Partial Response

terms.definition: The confirmed disappearance of all signs of cancer, and absence of molecular or cytogenetic marker of disease, in response to treatment with additional biochemical, immunological and histopathological analyses to verify the CR.
Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity based on predetermined boundaries. (NCI)
The size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer is neither decreasing nor increasing, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.
The absence of change or mild changes of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions based on a pre-defined threshold.
Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change. (NCI)
The lack of expected or desired effect related to a therapy. (NCI)
Leaving no doubt; not open to question. (NCI)

An increase in lesion size, based on a pre-defined threshold, or the development of new lesion(s), marked central fill-in of a lesion, or new enhancement of a previously homogeneously hypoattenuating nonenhancing mass.
Partial response with additional serum and urine M-protein reduction, but not meeting complete response.
In a declining condition or state.
